    • getCurrentFile

      public File getCurrentFile()
      Returns the currently associated file with the open image.

      This file represents the last location from which the image was opened or to which it was saved. If the image has not been saved or loaded yet, this method may return null.

      Returns:
      the File object representing the current image file, or null if none exists

    • setCurrentFile

      public void setCurrentFile(File file)
      Sets the current file associated with the open image.

      This method updates the reference to the file that represents the image currently being edited. It is typically called after opening an existing image file or saving a new one.

      Parameters:
      file - the File object to associate with the current image; may be null if no file is associated

    • isDirty

      public boolean isDirty()
      Checks whether the current image has unsaved changes.

      The dirty flag indicates if the image has been modified since the last save operation. If true, the user should be prompted to save changes before closing or opening a new file.

      Returns:
      true if the image has unsaved modifications, false otherwise

    • setDirty

      public void setDirty(boolean dirty)
      Sets the dirty state of the current image.

      This method updates the internal flag that tracks whether the image has unsaved changes. It should be called whenever an edit is made or after the image is successfully saved.

      Parameters:
      dirty - true to mark the image as having unsaved changes, false to indicate that all changes are saved

    • getSelectionBounds

      public Rectangle getSelectionBounds()
      Returns the current selection bounds on the canvas.

      The selection bounds define the rectangular region of the image that is currently selected for editing operations such as copy, cut, move, or transform. If no selection is active, this method may return null.

      Returns:
      the Rectangle representing the selection bounds, or null if no selection is active

    • setSelectionBounds

      public void setSelectionBounds(Rectangle selectionBounds)
      Sets the bounds of the current selection on the canvas.

      This method defines the rectangular region that will be treated as the active selection for operations such as copy, cut, move, or transform. Passing null clears the current selection.

      Parameters:
      selectionBounds - the Rectangle representing the new selection bounds, or null to clear the selection

    • getSelectionImage

      public BufferedImage getSelectionImage()
      Returns the image of the currently selected region.

      The selection image contains the pixel data within the selection bounds and can be used for operations such as copy, cut, paste, or transformations. If no selection is active, this method may return null.

      Returns:
      the BufferedImage representing the current selection, or null if no selection exists

    • setSelectionImage

      public void setSelectionImage(BufferedImage selectionImage)
      Sets the image for the current selection.

      This method defines the pixel data for the currently selected region on the canvas. It is typically used when copying, pasting, or modifying a selection. Passing null will clear the selection image.

      Parameters:
      selectionImage - the BufferedImage to use as the selection image, or null to clear the selection

    • isSelectionCut

      public boolean isSelectionCut()
      Checks whether the current selection is in "cut" mode.

      When a selection is cut, the original pixels in the selected area are removed (or made transparent) when the selection is moved, rather than just copied. This flag indicates whether the selection will be removed from its original location upon manipulation.

      Returns:
      true if the selection is marked as cut, false otherwise

    • setSelectionCut

      public void setSelectionCut(boolean cut)
      Sets whether the current selection is in "cut" mode.

      When a selection is marked as cut, the original pixels in the selected area will be removed (or made transparent) when the selection is moved, rather than copied. Setting this flag controls whether the selection behaves as a cut or copy.

      Parameters:
      cut - true to mark the selection as cut, false to mark it as a copy

    • setDragOffset

      public void setDragOffset(Point p)
      Sets the drag offset for the current selection.

      The drag offset represents the distance between the mouse cursor and the top-left corner of the selection when beginning a drag operation. This ensures smooth and accurate movement of the selection. If p is null, the offset defaults to (0, 0).

      Parameters:
      p - the Point representing the drag offset, or null to reset to (0, 0)

    • getDragOffset

      public Point getDragOffset()
      Returns the current drag offset for the active selection.

      The drag offset indicates the distance between the mouse cursor and the top-left corner of the selection at the start of a drag operation. It is used to ensure accurate positioning while moving the selection.

      Returns:
      a Point representing the current drag offset

    • clearSelection

      public void clearSelection()
      Clears the current selection from the canvas.

      This method removes the selection bounds and selection image, resets the drag offset to (0, 0), and marks the selection as not cut. After calling this method, no selection will be active.

    • getCurrentFileName

      public String getCurrentFileName()
      Returns the name of the currently associated file.

      If a file is associated with the current image, its name is returned. Otherwise, the method returns a default name "Untitled".

      Returns:
      the name of the current file, or "Untitled" if no file is set
